meanings.definition: Not kind or considerate; lacking in sympathy or compassion.
meanings.sent1: She was unkind to her friend by ignoring her when she needed help.
meanings.sent2: It is unkind to make fun of someone who is feeling sad.
meanings.sent3: Even though it was just a game, his unkind move made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unkind winter wind cut through their jackets like icy knives.
meanings.sent5: The unkind words left a lasting sting in her heart.

meanings.definition: Harsh or cruel in behavior or actions.
meanings.sent1: The unkind teacher scolded the students for a small mistake.
meanings.sent2: It was unkind of him to kick the stray cat that approached him.
meanings.sent3: The unkind boss made everyone work late on a Friday.
meanings.sent4: The unkind punishment seemed too severe for such a minor offense.
meanings.sent5: The unkind treatment of the prisoners shocked the international community.
